meanings.definition: To write on the outside or on a surface.
meanings.sent1: I will superscribe the address on the envelope.
meanings.sent2: Please superscribe your name on the form.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to superscribe a message on the back of the painting.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was superscribed on every letter she wrote.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll was superscribed with intricate symbols.

meanings.definition: To write above or over something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will superscribe the title on the chalkboard.
meanings.sent2: He likes to superscribe notes on his lecture slides.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to superscribe his friend's drawing.
meanings.sent4: His success story was superscribed by his hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow superscribed the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To write on the top of something.
meanings.sent1: She will superscribe the date on the document.
meanings.sent2: They decided to superscribe a quote on the monument.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to superscribe a secret ingredient on the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His legacy was superscribed on the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak was superscribed with snow in the winter.
